question_sentence: Which country instituted a four-day workweek and reported better well-being among workers and no harm to productivity?
The World Anti-Doping Agency bans a substance in the Olympics if it meets two of three criteria. Which isn't one of them?
choices: It could pose a health risk.

question_sentence: Eric Adams is one step closer to becoming New York City’s next mayor after winning the Democratic primary. He is:
Which chain has topped the American Customer Satisfaction Index’s list of best fast-food restaurants for the seventh year in a row?
With the Tokyo Summer Olympics weeks away, what percentage of Japan’s population has been vaccinated against COVID-19?
Which one of these couples announced their marriage over the July Fourth weekend?
choices: Michael B. Jordan and Lori Harvey

question_sentence: Which fast-food chain launched its loyalty program this week?
A major tech company’s CEO stepped down this week. Who was it?
Nintendo announced a new Switch model, out in October. The major addition to the console is:
What item did a confused Florida man recently receive in the mail from Expedia?
choices: A lock of Ariana Grande’s hair

question_sentence: Who is the most popular politician in the UK, according to YouGov’s latest quarterly rankings?
Nationalist parties from how many EU member states issued a joint declaration this week vowing to prevent the emergence of a ‘European superstate’?
Danish media ramped up Euro football fever in the run-up to the nation’s semi-final clash by evoking the name of which Viking warrior who conquered England in 1013?
Which country this week pledged to join the US in defending Taiwan if China tries to invade the island nation?
What is the name of the ‘psychic’ pig from Newcastle-upon-Tyne that has correctly predicted England’s last three Euro tournament results?
Renowned crime reporter Peter R. de Vries was gunned down in Amsterdam on Tuesday as he exited what?
Members of which group of technology companies have threatened to pull their services from Hong Kong over planned changes to data privacy laws?
Which British tennis star had to retire from Wimbledon this week after suffering breathing difficulties?
Graham Brady fought an election this week against which rival vying to claim his post as chair of the 1922 Committee of Tory backbenchers?
The president of which Caribbean island was assassinated by gunmen in his home in the early hours of Wednesday?
Pope Francis recently underwent what type of surgery, to which the Vatican said he “reacted well?”
evidence: Pope Francis, 84, underwent a scheduled surgery for colon diverticulitis in Rome’s Gemelli hospital – just hours after conducting traditional Sunday Angelus prayer in St. Peter’s Square.

question_sentence: A leaked health ministry document in Thailand has prompted public backlash and concerns over the effectiveness of which specific Covid-19 vaccine?
evidence: Leaked memos featuring an unnamed official expressed concern that if frontline workers received booster shots of a different vaccine after the Sinovac one, it would undermine public confidence in the Sinovac vaccine’s efficacy.

question_sentence: Another company was the target of a ransomware attack this week, potentially affecting thousands of clients across the globe. What kind of company was it?
evidence: Hackers targeted Kaseya, a software vendor that’s integrated into a range of IT management companies and their hundreds of respective corporate clients across the globe.

question_sentence: A tropical storm has wreaked havoc on Florida and the East Coast of the United States. What’s the storm’s name?
evidence: At one point reaching category 1 hurricane status, tropical storm Elsa made landfall in northern Florida, affecting over 30 million people during the course of its journey up the Eastern Seaboard.

question_sentence: A nationwide manhunt is now underway following the assassination of President Jovenel Moise, the leader of which country?
evidence: Moise was the president of Haiti, and was killed in an organized attack at his place of residence. Authorities are still trying to track down all involved, and several suspects are alleged to be international conspirators.

question_sentence: The global coronavirus death toll recently crossed another bleak threshold. The world has now lost more than how many people to Covid-19?
evidence: The world surpassed 4 million deaths due to Covid-19, with a third of the recorded numbers coming from the US, India and Brazil.

question_sentence: After weeks of contentious campaigning and issue-fraught voting tabulations, who has clinched the Democratic mayoral primary for New York City?
evidence: Brooklyn Borough President Eric Adams narrowly won New York’s Democratic mayoral primary, the city’s first election using ranked-choice voting.

question_sentence: In response to rising coronavirus cases in the country, Japan’s Olympics Committee has made what drastic decision regarding this summer’s Olympic Games?
choices: mandating face coverings for athletes during certain sports
locking down cities with Olympic venues
evidence: Japan’s Olympics Committee announced that spectators will be banned from venues at the already-delayed Tokyo 2020 Olympic Games.

question_sentence: Which NHL team won the Stanley Cup this week?
evidence: Striking twice in a row, the Tampa Bay Lighting went on to win the Stanley Cup, besting the Montreal Canadiens for the title in game 5 of the finals.

question_sentence: How many hot dogs did world champion competitive eater Joey Chestnut put away during this year’s Fourth of July hot dog eating contest?
evidence: Joey Chestnut reigned supreme, once again winning the Nathan’s Famous International Hot Dog Eating Contest with a record 76 consumed. It was the 14th time the hot dog eater won the title in the last 15 years.
